title: Cat. 7  Two-Handled Covered Cup, 1698/1720
publication_title: American Silver in the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Cornelius Kierstede (American, 1674–1757)  
New York, New York  
Silver; 12.7 × 20.3 × 12.7 cm (5 3/8 × 8 5/8 × 5 3/4 in.)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, restricted gift of Mrs. James W. Alsdorf, Pauline Seipp Armstrong, Marshall Field, Charles C. Haffner III, Mrs. Burton W. Hales, Mrs. Harold T. Martin, Mrs. C. Phillip Miller, Mr. and Mrs. Milo M. Naeve, Mrs. Eric Oldberg, Mrs. Frank L. Sulzberger, and the Ethel T.  
Scarborough Fund, 1984.1132

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section curatorial_entry" id="curatorial_entry">On side of each handle and three times on lid (fig. 7.1)

Engraved on body: Van Cortlandt family arms

Engraved on bottom: MCL and Petrus Stuyvesant / married / M.C. Livingston / 1730 (fig. 7.2)

Engraved on the lip of the underside of the cover: MCL

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Van Cortlandt family; Petrus Stuyvesant (1727–1805) and his wife, Margaret (Peggy) Livingston (1738–1818).

By descent to their daughter Cornelia Stuyvesant (1768–1825).

By descent to her son Reverend Petrus Stuyvesant Ten Broeck (1792–1849)

By descent to his daughter Harriet Cutter Ten Broeck Peabody (1833–1901).

By descent to her daughter Harriet Jessie Peabody Butler (born 1864) and Herman Beardsley Butler (1856–1904).

By descent in the Butler family to 1984.

Sold to Firestone and Parson, Boston, through Richard Norton, Inc., Chicago, 1984.

Sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1984.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Albany (NY) Institute of History and Art, In Remembrance of Patria, May 9–August 24, 1986, cat. 312.

Art Institute of Chicago, Art and Appetite: American Painting, Culture, and Cuisine, November 1, 2013–January 27, 2014, cat. 89; Amon Carter Museum of American Art, Fort Worth, TX, February 22–May 18, 2014.
